summary: The bill, titled the Refuge From Cruel Trapping Act, amends the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966. It prohibits the possession or use of body-gripping traps within the National Wildlife Refuge System, with specific exceptions for federal agencies managing invasive species or protecting threatened/endangered species, dismantling traps, Alaska, and members of Indian Tribes for subsistence purposes. Violators face fines, imprisonment, and forfeiture of traps/wildlife. The Secretary of the Interior is mandated to issue regulations, and the amendments take effect 120 days after enactment.
